website_summaries.verdict: While it isn't revolutionary, the Wii Zapper is a great Wii accessory--and for the price, you really are getting an excellent value.
pros: Inexpensive Wii accessory that brings new life to shooting games
cons: Doesn't come with Wiimote or Nunchuk
first round of supporting games aren't blockbusters

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Do you like shooting things? Did you enjoy the atmosphere of Twilight Princess? Do you like the Nintendo Wii, but wish there were more "sniping" games? Then this might be the game for you! It might seem silly at first to bolt your controllers onto this frame that makes it seem like you're holding a gun with a stock, but the subtle change in feeling of holding the controllers this way is satisfying. The game is simple but challenging. Playing the same levels repeatedly will reveal new surprises as you practice and get farther.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sagittaur

customer_reviews.title: Honest item description
customer_reviews.text: Everything was in the original box just as described, game sleeve had been ripped and taped but other than that everything looked new and worked well. Shipping was faster than expected and arrived a day early.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: good shooting game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: The price was right, and the game is a lot of fun for me and my 5 year old son. It's easy to unlock levels and advance, but getting a high score remains challenging. It's a lot like a game you'd play in an arcade, with fast action and not much else. The gun is easy to set up and works great. It meets all my expectations and seems built to last. It's nice that you only shoot targets and cartoonish creatures -- no blood, stalking, killing real things, etc. This is definitely the best shooting game for small kids that I've seen due to its tame targets and quick, easy gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: severalbeans

customer_reviews.title: Good mindless shooter.
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun for a while but the targets come out at the same place every time....gets predictable. Your trigger finger will get tired though, lots of shooting. The rifle type zapper helps a bit, but often times I find myself using everything but the zapper. The game alone is worth the price....zapper is an added bonus. If you only have a couple controllers, you will need another since the zapper does take a bit to set up. Odd that you use the front trigger to fire as well. Helps to steady your shot, and works well. Recommended for a cheap shooter game.
customer_reviews.author: Nukedude

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zappin' Fun
customer_reviews.text: I read there were a couple of complaints with the Wii Zapper. The alternative is the Nyko Wii Perfect Shot which actually has a spring in the trigger whereas the Wii Zapper does not. I ended up choosing the Wii Zapper because it was for my nephew and I knew he would enjoy the Link's Crossbow Training game. It really depends one what games you are playing. If you want the feel of a pistol then go with the Perfect Shot, if you want a fun game for 5 bones and want a rifle then purchase the Wii Zapper. Neither of these guns are perfect, you should be satisfied with either of them.
customer_reviews.author: Rozerem

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad effort
customer_reviews.text: got the game becasue I wanted the Zapper ! a bit disspointing that the zapper does not have a sight so you have to rely on the rectile in the screen. the game is short but very entertaining! finish the entire sequence in a day with my wife... it did have very innovative approach in the game design where by in the 1st person shooter, you can use the zapper and it is a much better way and faster and more precise than a joypad type that is use on Xbox or PS3.... I hope to see some titles using such techniques on the 1st person shooter. Ovverall very satisfied ...
customer_reviews.author: Tiong Guan Chng

customer_reviews.title: Zapper sucks, game is pretty fun
customer_reviews.text: I'm an adult male with a smallish build. The WII Zapper is uncomfortable to use at my size, and I would think it would be about impossible for bigger guys. The forward (trigger) hand is impeded by the bar that comes down behind the handle. In addition to being uncomfortable, I did not find it any easier or more accurate to shoot. I played Link's Crossbow Training, Ghost Squad and 007 with and without the Zapper, and I was equally accurate with both and actually faster without the Zapper. For me, the Zapper is worthless, but it might be more comfortable and better suited for kids.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $20-- probably my favorite game!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the traditional gamer type, but I've had so much fun playing Wii at friend's house I bought myself one the other day. I knew I wanted guitar hero 3, but otherwise I was pretty clueless about games. A neighbor child told me it was his favorite game and I figured for $20 it was worth the risk. What a fun game! My friends and I have played it non-stop since I bought the darn thing, and enjoyed every minute. Fast moving and very entertaining. The zapper is easy to put together, and very intuitive. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Games is good; Forget the Zapper ;<
customer_reviews.text: The Crossbow game is well-done and fun. However, the zapper is useless. It does not fit in the hand right and it is impossible to aim it like a gun. The sighting cursor is way off from where the zapper points. I found the game was much more fun and I got higher scores when I used the Remote by itself without putting it in the zapper. Because the Wii shooter games use a cursor sight instead of a light gun, a controller would be much more comfortable and effective to play them with. I'm keeping the game, buying a Wii controller, and ditchin' the zapper.
customer_reviews.author: Psyched123

customer_reviews.title: My 11 year old doesn't like.....
customer_reviews.text: While it's probably a better product than he thinks, I'm rating this based on his experience. He's only played it the once and because of his opinion, he hasn't reached for it to use it again. He didn't like that you couldn't pull the trigger and shoot with it in the real way you do with a gun; ie. with your pointer finger on the same arm hand you aim with. It bothered him a lot that right now he has a bad attitude with it. I'll try to review again once he's had more time with it and once me or my husband use it.
customer_reviews.author: JuJuBee

customer_reviews.title: great experience
customer_reviews.text: It was kind awkward at first to play with the Zapper, mostly because I was used to different control setting but it was not a big deal after a couple days. It provides a really nice shooting game experience. I thought it would be fragil and subject to cracks but It is made of really good material and seem very resistant so far. It is very easy to set the wii controls into the zapper. I use the zapper mostly on Call of Duty but my 5 year old daughter loves to play the crossbow training game that comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Bpetla

customer_reviews.title: It's a great concept, hence why I bought it
customer_reviews.text: It's a great concept, hence why I bought it, but the Wii system just isn't built for this type of stuff, in my opinion. The controls are pretty awkward in my experience. That being said, I would rather opt for a dedicated firearm controller thing, instead of an adapter for the Wii controllers.
customer_reviews.author: drkndbrn

customer_reviews.title: The Whole Family Loves It
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot easier for me to use the Wii zapper to play various shooting games than to use the nunchuck and the remote. This game was a blast! We fight over who gets to play with it (we end up being civil and taking turns) and pretty soon here we'll probably just buy a second zapper. I am not an avid gamer but I love the Wii because it's easy for everyone to use and more interactive than other gaming platforms. To sum up, I normally can't stand shooting games, but this one is great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for Call of Duty on the Wii (it was a gift). It's pretty fun using it. Don't know what else to say, like the title says, it does what it's suppose to do. The Link game is OKAY. It's one of those games you get bored of in 5 minutes. But when it's in expert mode or fast mode it's pretty fun... for 5 minutes. It is alright for practice with the crossbow too. Packaging was fine, came when it said it would.
customer_reviews.author: PookieThePirate

customer_reviews.title: What a waste
customer_reviews.text: This is right up there with one of the worst add on ideas in gaming history. Accuracy is horrible and build quality is severely lacking. Avoid this, you are better off just using the controller alone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sattler

customer_reviews.title: OK game with a zapper problem.
customer_reviews.text: The game is pretty fun when you get other people to play with you other than alone. The Wii zapper has a problem of ruining the nunchuck if you constantly mount and dismount it so just have one kept on there. Overall, it is a little awkward to have the trigger on the front instead of the rear. If you want to aim better, sure, it works, but be prepared to buy a used nunchuck so you don't go through a new one.
customer_reviews.author: H. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Wii design
customer_reviews.text: This looks simple; aim and shoot. However, depending on the game you need this for, the Wii controller requires you to hit buttons at times in very hard to reach places while trying to "aim". They need to design a controller that can be controlled from the "trigger finger" area, and not "on top" (of the front controller).
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Came used. Trigger didn’t reach the needed trigger point possibly because of wear
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin R. Fairfield

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great entertainment for the price! If you like the visuals of Zelda twilight Princess then you'll like this game. The only bad thing I found about this product is the zapper shape itself. Holding the front (trigger)grip forces me to bend my wrist quite awkwardly. If the gun was more comfortable I'd give this 5 stars for sure, but its a pretty big drawback for me.. especially if I intend to use this for other shooting games. All in all very glad i purchased its, fun fun.
customer_reviews.author: Silverk

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game and controller is way too much fun, and I'm over 40! Getting through the game on the first level (i.e.: medals) is not too difficult, although challenging enough to keep you entertained. The second and third levels are considerably more difficult. Levels are based on your ability to be accurate and fast, as well as see what is going on around you. This is an excellent trainer, and has improved my skills for more demanding games, like Call of Duty, and I can even use the controller as a rifle if I choose. Overall, I have no regrets, nor am I disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: definitely fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first game I bought after getting my Wii with Wii Sports. Having the Zapper definitely makes it easier to shot the targets. While the game play is not all that sophisticated it is a lot of fun and definitely showcases the features of the Wii Remote over other consoles. PS: I also ordered the 'Wii Perfect Shot Gun' by Nyko but have not received it yet. Still looking for good shoting games.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek

customer_reviews.title: The crossbow is a must for hunting games
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with the hunting game I bought my husband. It makes the hunt so much more realistic. All controllers seem to work just fine where they are placed as well, and it's easy to install both controllers. As a bonus the game that comes with it is pretty fun too, a little more violent than what I'd prefer, just target practice would be fine with me. But it just adds another game to our stash.
customer_reviews.author: J. Send

customer_reviews.title: The Zapper's Back
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy plastic housing "Zapper" alone, but since it was packaged Link's Crossbow Training I bought it. The other plastic gun style housing are kind of a ripoff since they don't incorporate the nunchuk and don't have a game included. The two handed design allows for greater accuracy with out sacrificing speed. It may feel strange pulling the trigger in the front grip but you get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: The Wii Zapper is a great addition to your Wii Collection
customer_reviews.text: I received my Wii Zapper today and was very happy with the quality of the Zapper itself as well as the quality and fun of the included game. I've been playing it for awhile and am a little bit tired, crampy from the ergonomic nature of the Zapper. The game and Zapper are fun nonetheless, but I found myself a little tired after about 30 minutes of play. Great game and a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Diana de Avila

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This makes any light gun game much more enjoyable to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: This Wii Zapper is very nice, easy to operate, just connect your wii remote and nunchuk to it and start having fun. The zapper was unused and in excellent condition. Also, it came with crossbow shooting game. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kecia Horton

customer_reviews.title: If you love the Legend of Zelda, consider it, if not then I would recommend skipping the Wii Zapper.
customer_reviews.text: The Wii Zapper with Link's Crossbow Training is super fun; for about 30 minutes to an hour. Then you realize that there is nothing much to it. It's a good buy if you are a Legend of Zelda fan, but if it wasn't for the Link's Crossbow Training I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan231r

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but useless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the crossbow training, not for the zapper. Crossbow training is a fun game, and its cool to play in the levels from twilight princess which is one of my favorite zelda games to date (skyward sword is coming in a week, so we'll see if it changes :P). But besides link's crossbow training, I really have no use for the zapper..... Cool, but useless.
customer_reviews.author: bluepanda

customer_reviews.title: The zapper is fine, the game is defective
customer_reviews.text: The game did not work when I put it in the console! "An error has occurred. Press eject button and remove the disc, then turn the Wii console off..." I am so upset.
customer_reviews.author: Oksana D.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly I Had Fun w/This!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my boyfriend's son and was pleasantly surprised with the game that came with it. We all tried it out and I became pretty competitive (But of course was no match for my police officer boyfriend who blew us all out of the water with his skills!!) Nonetheless, I actually had fun with this and am contemplating getting one for my Wii system! I will say that my controller seemed to have the battery life sucked out of it a lot quicker though...which didn't make that much sense to me, but that's the only thing I noticed. For $20, this really offers a lot!!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Makes games more fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old son for Christmas. At first he didn't like it because it was hard to get used too. Then he tried the Link Cross Bow training game that came with it and now I have to pry it from his hands. It makes any shooting game on the Wii much more fun and eaiser to manipulate than with just the Wii controller. It is worth the $[...].
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only used it like two times kind of pointless, but kids like it I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: SolidSShady

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are a shooter fan
customer_reviews.text: The Zapper is pretty much just a shell that you put your Wiimote into. This would be a pretty cool peripheral if there were more shooting games out there for the Wii, but unfortunately there are hard to come by. A system is only as good as the games that are offered on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hendo

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device and game for my girlfriends Wii. She found the device to be easy to use. Although the cross hairs are not centered with the device it works very well and is easy to follow directions about how to place the controller and nun-chuck into device. I think the developers of the Wii did a great job making this device.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun
customer_reviews.text: The Wii Zapper was a great purchase. I can never find it in the stores but knew Amazon had it. We bought my son 007 Quantum of Solace but had to buy a cheaper version of the Zapper. It was OK but was difficult to use so we decided to get him the real thing after we bought Paintball. The only problem with the Zapper is the Wii remote does not fit correctly if you have the rechargeable battery in. It still can be used but isn't locked in place. My son also loves the Link's Crossbow Training game that came with it. I would recommend purchasing the Zapper for your shooting games.
customer_reviews.author: V. McMillen

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy playing this game as a family
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy playing this game as a family. Its nice to have a shooting game that is not blood and guts and shooting people. We can play this one with our kids. At lest the first couple levels before it gets to hard for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Link's Crossbow Training and Zapper
customer_reviews.text: This game was super fun! Very easy to control and learn to control the WII Zapper. The WII-mote and nunchuck popped right into the gun with no problem. I love how the cord wraps up inside the handle so it isn't just dangling around when you are playing a shooting game. Amazon made this very affordable and i received quickly too. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: HMK

customer_reviews.title: Great gun and game
customer_reviews.text: The gun fits nicely in the hands...My fiance and I both love it, and our hand size is very different. The trigger being in the front is not an issue, and is easy to get used to (better that than the regular controller). The Links game is also a great deal. Not only does it give you practice using the Zapper, it is also a blast to play.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Mug

customer_reviews.title: Good Concept, needs work
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest game, but hey it was cheep. The zapper is just a waste of space. I thought it would be cool to have, but it's easier to play without it. The game needs work, its got a good concept, but is only fun for a few hours. This is coming from a game nerd with over 6K in games & equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Flight_173

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was going to be very usefull. ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to be very usefull... not really. But, it really does take Link's Crossbow Training to a new level.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: A gun and a decent game for $20? You bet! Okay, the first disc shipped to me wouldn't play, but Amazon quickly replaced it and the replacement works great. It's a pretty entertaining game and people who come visit seem to enjoy it. Is it non-stop fun? No, but it's a great value. I recommend it to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: CTCraftBrew

customer_reviews.title: Zapperific
customer_reviews.text: I am no gamer and usually chide my boyfriend for all the time he wastes in his gory virtual realities. But, since trying the zapper, I've found something very therapeutic about blowing things up. Unlike the controllers that have kept me from playing in the past, the zapper feels intuitive to me and my hands and fingers don't cramp after hours of playing. The included game can be addictive but leaves me craving more than the minute or so that I'm allowed to compete for each stage. Too bad there aren't more games out yet that utilize the zapper. I'm waiting for Legend of Zelda....
customer_reviews.author: sdavid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Accessory for Wii Point & Shoot Games
customer_reviews.text: This accessory and game are both great and go perfectly together. Using this zapper attachment while playing Link's Crossbow Training definitely made it a better overall experience. Great price and kept me entertained for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: XDanteX

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile Wii accessory for shooting games
customer_reviews.text: I like the Wii zapper and the simple game that came with it. The kids have fun with the learning game (Link's Crossbow) and I can use it for my more mature games. No major complaints and I can use it for a couple of hours without getting a sore trigger finger (the trigger isn't spring loaded).
customer_reviews.author: B. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shooter Game & Gun.
customer_reviews.text: Me & my 2 sons (Ages 5 & 7) love playing this and trying to best our highest scores. no blood, guts, or gore. plenty of standing targets and later bad guys to shoot - and not a long mundane game either. you can't go wrong since a zapper gun is included in the price too!
customer_reviews.author: Russell R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Terrific game with lots of different shooting styles
customer_reviews.text: We just bought the Wii this holiday season and this game has ended up being more popular than ones for which we paid money (It came with our Wii Zapper). You can shoot skeet style, target style, and more. Lots of different games. The graphics are good and the options for practice are fun on their own, with varying levels of skill required, so even young children can play (provided they can handle the zapper to begin with, so maybe ages 6 or 7 and up could play).
customer_reviews.author: malley5678

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After playing with this thing for 20 minutes or longer expect to start feeling uncomfortable. They should make one that lets you bring the nunchuk further back so it's not so close in that awkward position. The Zelda game that comes with it though is fun, short, but fun.
customer_reviews.author: IronBuddha

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper and Crossbow Training
customer_reviews.text: I had this game in the past and I liked it. My kids wrecked the last game so I bought another gun and game set. My only complaint is that you can play through the game a little fast. Then you have to go back and try to improve on your scores.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Vega

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory/game for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Wii Zapper is a great peripheral for any Wii owner, especially with the current crop of shooter games. The remote and nunchuck fit into the Zapper cleanly. Link's Crossbow training is included, and while fun, it isn't much of a challenge to beat. It took me all of a day to master and toss aside.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Beeson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! For all ages and really fun even if you don't like Zelda games.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shooter game with great graphics. There are various levels in this point and shoot game with the targets presented in different ways to keep it interesting. Fun to play solo or against friends. Not tons of replay value but a good value for the price and you get the zapper which you can use for other games. If you like shooter games try it out, it is fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: HeyJoeAlvarez

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, good value.
customer_reviews.text: The Wii Zapper is well made. It holds the controller firmly and definitely helps your ability to aim in the game. The game has great replay value. For only $20, you'll get a good, fun game and an accessory that will last. The package shipped quickly and everything was as advertised. I'd recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does what it supposed to do my wii controls cradled in without little effort. I would suggest helping younger children until they get the hang of wrapping cord inside handle.. Oh yeah the crossbow game is pretty neat just a point and shoot ..
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Disk read error
customer_reviews.text: I've played this game before and it's fun only problem is is the person I bought it from the disk read error in my Wii so disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ulery

customer_reviews.title: The Wii Zapper is great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the cheap price just for the wii zapper but i'm sure the game is fantastic aswell. However, those buyers from outside the US be prepared for the game to not work as the Wii console does have region limitations. In saying that, I live in Australia and i bought this product for about half the Australian price so in my opinion it was worth taking the gamble for the game not to work. I still got the fantastic Wii Zapper which adds a whole new element to FPS games, of which my favourite would have to be Call Of Duty : Modern Warfare Reflex. Overall a fantastic buy and highly recommended to all Wii users
customer_reviews.author: Nick Bulman

customer_reviews.title: a quality zapper for a wii controller..
customer_reviews.text: a quality zapper for a wii controller.. really enhances the game play
customer_reviews.author: T00nZ

customer_reviews.title: It's not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this product. The format is just so different than what I'm used to, having cut my teeth on the Wii controller with the nunchuck. The problem is not with the product or its functionality. It's just not what I'm used to, so I've not used it but twice.
customer_reviews.author: BLMiller

customer_reviews.title: wii gun
customer_reviews.text: the wii zapper with crossbow is a great set of games. for all ages, it is great for vision and motion. and a whole lot of fun to try and beat each other at the scores. i would suggest this with this great price for everyone. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Discover

customer_reviews.title: Zap....Zapp.......Zapper....Good !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Nintendo wii Zapper comes complete with the crossbow training link (Zelda) game; which is really fantastic to play. However, the zapper doesn't have a lot of games to accompany it that is the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy happy happy, original zapper from nintendo, and game, all in new condition, I cannot complain. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: E3flee

customer_reviews.title: Zapper feels great, game is much more in depth than expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought Link's Crossbow Training would be a small little minigame to demonstrate the Wii Zapper, but the game is surprisingly very in depth- lots of levels and achievements to be earned. Still haven't got the highest score on all the levels yet. Graphics are pretty good, controls are pretty comfortable and adjustable. Overall better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: SUCH a great product
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product is class. It work spectacularly with the Wii and FPS like Goldeney (which is the only reason I bought this). It also comes included with Link's Crowbow Training. It's okay... nothing fun or spectacular but a nice way to introduce yourself to the controls of the Wii zapper. Definitely worth the buy but (as a warning) if you're coming from playing FPS on the Classic Controller there is definitely a learning curve!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Awkward but I enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Like holding a little plastic shotgun and trying to aim at things on your TV. Still fun Zelda game. Like a big minigame from Twlight Princess.
customer_reviews.author: Cregg L.

customer_reviews.title: One of THE most fun Wii games there is!
customer_reviews.text: I went to visit my almost 70 year old Aunt last night and we stayed up playing this game until 2am to beat the levels! First thing this morning we then resumed our play for HOURS. This game is absolutely the best Wii game I have played yet!!! I came on here to buy one for my own family!!!! This is a definite MUST have if you like shooting games and in general fun games!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lenihan

customer_reviews.title: Bad design but fun game
customer_reviews.text: The zapper was badly designed. The angle was all wrong, if you use the zapper for more than 20 minutes, you'll get a cramp on your wrist. The game was good as expected; however, the multiplayer option does not work -- a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jonq

customer_reviews.title: Wii Crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Works w/hunting programs but none of the games are that great to begin with so we don't use it much. Seems to serve it's purpose at best.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great game for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've been playing Zelda since it was introduced 25 years ago...and it's had it's ups and downs. However, I think this accessory game is GREAT, and I didn't even really like Twilight Princess that much. I would've given it give stars if it had more levels...as it is, we played through all the levels in one day. It took about a week to get platinums in all the levels...so...but what should I expect from a game that really isn't a full game? It's lots of fun to play, and my children love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: MrsLaVallie

customer_reviews.title: It works but...
customer_reviews.text: It's a pain in the rear end to set it up with the remote. If you have an extra remote and nunchuck set so you can leave it set up then it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: not spectacular and not a total flop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it years ago and have only played it once or twice. So, not spectacular and not a total flop as I still own it.
customer_reviews.author: TJR

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Link's Crossbow Training and the Wii Zapper are a must have at $20. The Wii Zapper has a pretty sleek design (hiding cables) and is straightforward to use. The game itself is fun and challenging for users of all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Etzel C. Brower Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Zapper is not Good
customer_reviews.text: Here's the problem. Works OK on games where the shooting area doesn't leave the screen, like a bullseye that isn't moving. In a first person shooter game with controls formatted for the zapper...I found myself dioriented. I need to turn 180 degrees to shoot the guy to my right, but that is actually about 45 degrees or just off screen. It looks fun, but ends up being a pain in the butt to use. My kid threw it down after 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: What a blast....very addicting.
customer_reviews.text: This game is extremely addicting. The wii remote and nun chuck snap easily into and out of the crossbow, although you obviously must remove the wii skin from the remote first which is a little annoying. This game really tests your skill at aim and you quickly get hooked to attempt to improve your score. A must have accessory and game for your wii!
customer_reviews.author: D&M

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for all first person shooter games!!! Has the nun-chuck attachment on the end makes it very versatile and easier to match up with your opponents.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D Holroyd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Item!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wii zapper along with Call of Duty: Black Ops. I thought that having one of these would help a lot. The wii controller and the nunchuk fit perfectly into the slots. In general, the zapper is very well built and has a very comfortable grip. If you are pondering about whether to buy one or not... I would recommend you definitely get one! It's worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: wiigamer

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: The kids like this enhancement for the Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 09 game. You don't need the gun to play, it just makes it more authentic. Took awhile to get used to but they have alot of fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: The Zapper adds to Goldeneye
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the Goldeneye game. It is good for that but I honestly don't care much for the game that it came with. It is pretty lame. You would be silly to buy this just for the game it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: BHend

customer_reviews.title: still working.
customer_reviews.text: still being used about two years after i bought it for my 8 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Disliked The discription of the item is not what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Disliked The discription of the item is not what I recd. I didn't receive the zappers just the game. And after to trying to play the game it wouldn't play because of the scratches on the disk.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Needs re-invention
customer_reviews.text: The zapper is actually a very poor design. Namely the trigger is on the front grip which causes the user to have his/her hand in an awkward position while firing. Within just an hour of game play, your wrist begins to get sore. The game developers are great. Unfortunately, game accessory developers are slack. Clearly it was not tested for any serious amount of time or they would have discovered the flaw themselves. The trigger mechanism should be extended back for a more natural grip. If you can, hold out for the next generation of zapper when they finally get the point to re-invent the design.
customer_reviews.author: book_hero

customer_reviews.title: Please buy me
customer_reviews.text: Great game device, really helps, even though the toughest of gaming situations.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Coplin

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: This Zapper is great!! The Link's Crossbow Training game that came with it is also so much fun to play. Gets you used to playing with it and I love the space for the nunchuk, very helpful!!
customer_reviews.author: SweetJerseyMom

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: always thought, Why buy a piece of plastic but I had to take the chance and see why so many people do, in fact, now I realize Why, so much realistic experience, I recommend it 100%
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Burneo

customer_reviews.title: Zapper with crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Works great with everything held in place for lots of fun play. Would recommend this to anyone. My 7 year old grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this person
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. I would like to give it a Negative 100000+. It says it comes with the zapper and game and has a pic of the box with the game but got a zapper that is missing a piece and NO Game. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great game and accesory. My wife and I have been playing this game for hours now. The reason why I did not give it a 5 star is the multiplayer feature. Nintendo should have provided a mini game where multiple users could play on at the same time. Aside from this, it has a fun build in and I got my wife hooked!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.Top Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Wii Zapper
customer_reviews.text: Nice set up, works well so far with the games I have. It was 20 bucks with a game! Good deal. It is a little small for adults but works well. Nice cord management for the nunchuck.
customer_reviews.author: C. Horrisberger

customer_reviews.title: Links Great Fun for EVERYONE
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this Product. Links training games are GREAT FUN !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Wii accessory
customer_reviews.text: The zapper is great. It makes it so much easier to play shooting games. The included game is pretty good. It is a fun shooting challenge without being violent or gory.
customer_reviews.author: K. Waechter

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: works great with Wii controllers and the kids loved it. now its time to get get more games that work with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: firas issa

customer_reviews.title: In perfect condition although it was used and the game works ...
customer_reviews.text: In perfect condition although it was used and the game works perfectly no scratches at all!! Defiantly would purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this item for another game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for * the house of the dead 2& 3 return game* and I love it!!! However, the game comes with wii zapper just an okay! Great price for the item tho.!
customer_reviews.author: Artsypup

customer_reviews.title: Just like the picture, best shooting controller
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like the photo, moderately comfortable to hold. If you are looking for a shooting style controller, this one is the best there is. The video game was a nice bonus as well. While it's short in duration, it was fun to play with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bennett

customer_reviews.title: The ergonomics aren't great.
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomics on the blaster aren't great. Some of my friends like this more than I do so I kept it, but if it was just me then I'd have returned this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Accessory to wii
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Link's crossbow training with the zapper and Call of Duty world at war and I had so much fun playing it with the Zapper its actually a different experience when you are carrying the zapper in hand and engaging in a battle. As for link Crossbow training its not a game but rather a Zapper trainer for this price I think its a very good combination
customer_reviews.author: Karim Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: good concept, the expert player doesn't use it anymore though
customer_reviews.text: This Wii zapper was expected to be used all the time by our 10 year old, but after just a few weeks I noticed he wasn't using it anymore. He thinks that the game suite that came with the zapper is fun to play, but he feels he has better control of movement by using the wii remote and nunchuk WITHOUT installing them in the zapper, so the zapper just sits in the game bin.
customer_reviews.author: ElectroGuru

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Exactly what my son needed for some of his games. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Have worked in plastic molding operations in the past. Very well designed and produced product. Well worth the $19.95 The game is really 'icing on the cake"
customer_reviews.author: Raymann

customer_reviews.title: Good gun
customer_reviews.text: Good assembly of product. I enjoy playing games with it. And the game they give with it when you purchase it is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Bought this with a Zelda Target Game
customer_reviews.text: My sister suggested the Wii Zapper to me because I enjoy shooting and target games. We ordered a Zelda game to go along with it and have had a lot of family fun playing it. You can use the game in single player mode or challenge mode. It is fun to see who gets the highest score or to improve on a past score. The Wii Zapper works great!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kight

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: The Zapper gun is well designed and fun to use. the game is great fun. It takes you through many games that get harder to win. Hours or fun!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the purpose for which i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ray

product_meta.title: Official Wii Zapper with Link's Crossbow Training
product_meta.description:
The Wii Zapper is a gun peripheral that allows the user to insert a Wii Remote and Nunchuk, both sold separately, into either end and play a compatible game. The control stick on the Nunchuk controls player movement (on stages that allow player movement), while aiming the Wii Zapper moves the targeting reticule on the screen. The Zapper comes with Link's Crossbow Training, which helps to familiarize the player with the Zapper in a shooting gallery style game. Link's Crossbow Training contains three game styles: target shooting, defender and ranger. 

 Features:


 

 * Target Shooting: In target-shooting rounds, players shoot bull's-eyes as they pop up on the screen. In early stages, targets are stationary. As the game difficulty increases in later levels, the targets move. Hitting the center of the bull's-eye nets more points, and hitting targets in succession without missing earns combo multipliers. Link can aim anywhere on the screen. 
 * Defender: In defender rounds, players remain stationary but can look and aim in all directions by aiming off screen. Hordes of enemies assault Link, and he must fight them off. These battles have a great deal of variety, from fighting off skeletons in a desert to defending a wagon from boar-riding Bokoblins. 
 * Ranger: In ranger rounds, players can move throughout the level using the control stick and aim anywhere they want by aiming the Wii Zapper wherever they want to look. In these missions, Link storms enemy encampments, fights his way through a forest and seeks out his foes while exploring the environments. 
 * The Wii Remote and Nunchuk are sold separately
feature_bullets: Wii Zapper comes with Link's Cross Bow Training Game
Wii Remote and Nunchuk are sold seperately
